definitions.definition: used to say that a particular situation or state will always exist

examples.text: After her death, their lives changed forever.
Just keep telling yourself that it won't **last forever**.
The local dairy industry will soon be lost forever.
The final death toll may forever remain a mystery.
It takes her forever to get dressed.
Where have you been? I've been waiting forever!

definitions.definition: used with verbs in the progressive tenses to say that somebody does something very often and in a way that is annoying to other people

examples.text: She's forever going on about how poor they are.
